edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.maxlikelihood

Class VotedPerceptron

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.WeightLearningApplication
        • edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.maxlikelihood.VotedPerceptron
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModelApplication
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpectationMaximization, LatentTopicNetworkMaxPseudoLikelihood, LatentTopicNetworkMaxPseudoLikelihood_Naive, LazyMaxLikelihoodMPE, MaxLikelihoodMPE, MaxPseudoLikelihood

    public abstract class VotedPerceptron
extends WeightLearningApplication
    TODO: rewrite class documentation to describe general gradient-based learning algorithms TODO: refactor class so loss augmentation is a strategy that can only be applied to inference-based learning objectives Learns new weights for the CompatibilityKernels in a Model using the voted perceptron algorithm.

    The weight-learning objective is to maximize the likelihood according to the distribution:

    p(X) = 1 / Z(w) * exp{-sum[w * f(X)]}

    where X is the set of RandomVariableAtoms, f(X) the incompatibility of each GroundKernel, w is the weight of that GroundKernel, and Z(w) is a normalization factor.

    The voted perceptron algorithm starts at the current weights and at each step computes the gradient of the objective, takes that step multiplied by a step size (possibly truncated to stay in the region of feasible weights), and saves the new weights. The components of the gradient are each divided by the number of GroundCompatibilityKernels from that Kernel. The learned weights are the averages of the saved weights.

    For the gradient of the objective, the expected total incompatibility is computed by subclasses in #computeExpectedIncomp(List, double[]).
